html: While I could not vote in support of this measure today, it incorporates legislation I worked on to improve election security and to protect our elections from foreign interference. (3/4)
text: While I could not vote in support of this measure today, it incorporates legislation I worked on to improve election security and to protect our elections from foreign interference. (3/4)

html: But the bill before the House today represents a significant constitutional overreach that would attempt to establish a publicly funded electoral system, which I staunchly oppose. (2/4)
text: But the bill before the House today represents a significant constitutional overreach that would attempt to establish a publicly funded electoral system, which I staunchly oppose. (2/4)

html: I applaud the end of this lengthy and costly government shutdown. The past month has been a political show by both sides and has revealed deep divides within Congress. As we move forward, I believe we must use this as an opportunity to compromise.
text: I applaud the end of this lengthy and costly government shutdown. The past month has been a political show by both sides and has revealed deep divides within Congress. As we move forward, I believe we must use this as an opportunity to compromise.

html: Lead-based paint has created a public health crisis in Syracuse for far too long. This week, Syracuse was approved for a $4.1 million grant to combat the issues created by lead-based paint. This is a great win for Syracuse and I was pleased to support this funding application.
